channel.title: Spring JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [SEC-376] FilterSecurityInterceptor is not applied to /j_acegi_switch_user
item.description:
FilterSecurityInterceptor is not applied to /j_acegi_switch_user

e.g. using /j_acegi_switch_user=SUPERUSER

Whilst it is possible to protect the url that renders the form that eventually submits to /j_acegi_switch_user, it is possible to circumvent this using a hand-crafted url

e.g.http://localhost:9090/my-app/j_acegi_switch_user?j_username=some.user

see forum entry for more details http://forum.springframework.org/showthread.php?t=29621&highlight=j_acegi_switch_user

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I've read through the entire thread and I it seems like the original reported in the thread had some trouble with configuration.

The reporter of this issue has reproduced the problem. Can you please post your FilterChainProxy and FilterSecurityInterceptor XML configuration to this issue (preferably as an XML file attachment).

The j_acegi_switch_user URL would be handled exactly like any other URL by FilterSecurityInterceptor, and accordingly I cannot see any reason why we'd be having a particular bug around it. Anyhow, let's have a look at your configuration more closely and take it from there.
No response from reporter, closing bug as cannot reproduce.

Hi Ben. Sorry I didn't respond quick enough. You pick up the issue one month after I submit it, and only give me three days to reply? Sorry. I'm away from the UK for a few weeks (in your fair Sydney). Can't seem to attach a file to JIRA, maybe as the issue is closed, so I apologies for pasting it into this message.

Happy for the issue to remain closed. As and wehn I'm in a position to use Spring again, i'll look into the issue (left my last job). shame we never met. About to have lunch with Richard Atkinsn and the RBA crew. I left before you got involved there,

Here's the config

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<beans xmlns="http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans"
xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
xsi:schemaLocation="
http://www.springframework.org/schema/beans http://schemas.leadx.com/spring/spring-beans-2.0.xsd
">

<!--
order of interceptors is really important. consult the documentatio and examples.
if you wish to use channel security for SSL, add "channelProcessingFilter," in front
of "httpSessionContextIntegrationFilter" in the list below -->
<bean id="filterChainProxy"
class="org.acegisecurity.util.FilterChainProxy">
<property name="filterInvocationDefinitionSource">
<value>
CONVERT_URL_TO_LOWERCASE_BEFORE_COMPARISON
PATTERN_TYPE_APACHE_ANT
/**=httpSessionContextIntegrationFilter,logoutFilter,authenticationProcessingFilter,rememberMeProcessingFilter,switchUserProcessingFilter,exceptionTranslationFilter,filterInvocationInterceptor
</value>
</property>
</bean>

<!-- **************************************************
httpSessionContextIntegrationFilter

                                                                                                        • -->
                                                                                                          <bean id="httpSessionContextIntegrationFilter"
                                                                                                          class="org.acegisecurity.context.HttpSessionContextIntegrationFilter" />

<!-- **************************************************
authenticationProcessingFilter

                                                                                                        • -->
                                                                                                          <bean id="authenticationProcessingFilter"
                                                                                                          class="org.acegisecurity.ui.webapp.AuthenticationProcessingFilter">
                                                                                                          <property name="authenticationManager" ref="authenticationManager" />
                                                                                                          <property name="filterProcessesUrl"><value>/j_acegi_security_check</value></property>
                                                                                                          <property name="authenticationFailureUrl"><value>/public/login.jspa?fail=true</value></property>
                                                                                                          <property name="defaultTargetUrl"><value>/user/welcome.jspa</value></property>
                                                                                                          <property name="rememberMeServices" ref="rememberMeServices" />
                                                                                                          </bean>

<bean id="authenticationManager"
class="org.acegisecurity.providers.ProviderManager">
<property name="providers">
<list>
<ref bean="daoAuthenticationProvider" />
<ref bean="rememberMeAuthenticationProvider"/>
</list>
</property>
<!-->property name="sessionController" ref="concurrentSessionController" / -->
</bean>

<bean id="daoAuthenticationProvider"
class="org.acegisecurity.providers.dao.DaoAuthenticationProvider">
<property name="userDetailsService" ref="userDetailsService" />
<property name="passwordEncoder" ref="passwordEncoder"/>
</bean>

<bean id="passwordEncoder"
class="org.acegisecurity.providers.encoding.Md5PasswordEncoder" />

<!-- **************************************************
rememberMeProcessingFilter

                                                                                                        • -->
                                                                                                          <bean id="rememberMeProcessingFilter"
                                                                                                          class="org.acegisecurity.ui.rememberme.RememberMeProcessingFilter">
                                                                                                          <property name="authenticationManager" ref="authenticationManager" />
                                                                                                          <property name="rememberMeServices" ref="rememberMeServices" />
                                                                                                          </bean>

<bean id="rememberMeServices"
class="org.acegisecurity.ui.rememberme.TokenBasedRememberMeServices">
<property name="userDetailsService" ref="userDetailsService" />
<property name="key"><value>celinedion</value></property>
<!-- 1209600 is 14 days in seconds -->
<property name="tokenValiditySeconds"><value>1209600</value></property>
</bean>

<bean id="rememberMeAuthenticationProvider"
class="org.acegisecurity.providers.rememberme.RememberMeAuthenticationProvider">
<property name="key"><value>celinedion</value></property>
</bean>

<!-- **************************************************
switchUserProcessingFilter

                                                                                                        • -->
                                                                                                          <!-- Filter used to switch the user context. Note: the switch and exit url must be secured
                                                                                                          based on the role granted the ability to 'switch' to another user -->

<!-- NOTE: There is a serious security flaw with user-switching in release 1.0.2
see http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/spring/browse/SEC-204
and http://forum.springframework.org/showthread.php?t=29621
-->
<bean id="switchUserProcessingFilter"
class="org.acegisecurity.ui.switchuser.SwitchUserProcessingFilter">
<property name="userDetailsService" ref="userDetailsService" />
<property name="switchUserUrl"><value>/j_acegi_switch_user</value></property>
<property name="exitUserUrl"><value>/j_acegi_exit_user</value></property>
<property name="targetUrl"><value>/user/welcome.jspa</value></property>
</bean>

<!-- **************************************************
logoutFilter

                                                                                                        • -->
                                                                                                          <bean id="logoutFilter"
                                                                                                          class="org.acegisecurity.ui.logout.LogoutFilter">
                                                                                                          <constructor-arg value="/public/login .jspa"/> <!-- URL redirected to after logout -->
                                                                                                          <constructor-arg>
                                                                                                          <list>
                                                                                                          <bean class="com.leadx.web.acegi.HttpSessionLogoutHandler" />
                                                                                                          <ref bean="rememberMeServices" />
                                                                                                          <bean class="org.acegisecurity.ui.logout.SecurityContextLogoutHandler" />
                                                                                                          </list>
                                                                                                          </constructor-arg>
                                                                                                          </bean>

<!-- **************************************************
exceptionTranslationFilter

                                                                                                        • -->
                                                                                                          <bean id="exceptionTranslationFilter"
                                                                                                          class="org.acegisecurity.ui.ExceptionTranslationFilter">
                                                                                                          <property name="authenticationEntryPoint" ref="authenticationProcessingFilterEntryPoint" />
                                                                                                          <property name="accessDeniedHandler">
                                                                                                          <bean class="org.acegisecurity.ui.AccessDeniedHandlerImpl">
                                                                                                          <property name="errorPage" value="/accessDenied.html"/>
                                                                                                          </bean>
                                                                                                          </property>
                                                                                                          </bean>

<bean id="authenticationProcessingFilterEntryPoint"
class="org.acegisecurity.ui.webapp.AuthenticationProcessingFilterEntryPoint">
<property name="loginFormUrl"><value>/public/login.jspa</value></property>
<property name="forceHttps"><value>no</value></property>
</bean>

<!-- **************************************************
filterInvocationInterceptor

                                                                                                        • -->
                                                                                                          <!-- Note the order that entries are placed against the objectDefinitionSource is critical.
                                                                                                          The FilterSecurityInterceptor will work from the top of the list down to the FIRST pattern that matches the request URL.
                                                                                                          Accordingly, you should place MOST SPECIFIC (ie a/b/c/d.) expressions first, with LEAST SPECIFIC (ie a/.) expressions last -->
                                                                                                          <bean id="filterInvocationInterceptor"
                                                                                                          class="org.acegisecurity.intercept.web.FilterSecurityInterceptor">
                                                                                                          <property name="authenticationManager" ref="authenticationManager" />
                                                                                                          <property name="accessDecisionManager" ref="accessDecisionManager" />
                                                                                                          <property name="objectDefinitionSource">
                                                                                                          <value>
                                                                                                          CONVERT_URL_TO_LOWERCASE_BEFORE_COMPARISON
                                                                                                          PATTERN_TYPE_APACHE_ANT
                                                                                                          /user/**=CALLCENTREEXECUTIVE, UNDERLORD, OVERLORD
                                                                                                          /admin/**=ACCOUNTMANAGER
                                                                                                          /su/**=OVERLORD
                                                                                                          /j_acegi_switch_user=OVERLORD
                                                                                                          /j_acegi_logout=OVERLORD

</value>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="accessDecisionManager"
class="org.acegisecurity.vote.AffirmativeBased">
<property name="allowIfAllAbstainDecisions"><value>false</value></property>
<property name="decisionVoters">
<list>
<ref bean="roleVoter" />
</list>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="roleVoter"
class="org.acegisecurity.vote.RoleVoter">
<!-- defualt prefix is ROLE, btu we can happily not use a prefix. see JavaDoc for RoleVoter -->
<property name="rolePrefix"><value></value></property>
</bean>

<!-- **************************************************
method invocation security Interceptor

  • not a filter as not tied to presnetation tier
                                                                                                        • -->
                                                                                                          <bean id="methodSecurityInterceptor"
                                                                                                          class="org.acegisecurity.intercept.method.aopalliance.MethodSecurityInterceptor">
                                                                                                          <property name="validateConfigAttributes"><value>false</value></property> <!-- evaluates at startup if the provided configuration attributes are valid -->
                                                                                                          <property name="authenticationManager" ref="authenticationManager" />
                                                                                                          <property name="accessDecisionManager" ref="accessDecisionManager" />
                                                                                                          <property name="objectDefinitionSource" ref="objectDefinitionSource" />
                                                                                                          </bean>

<bean id="objectDefinitionSource"
class="org.acegisecurity.intercept.method.MethodDefinitionAttributes">
<property name="attributes" ref="attributes" />
</bean>

<bean id="attributes"
class="org.acegisecurity.annotation.SecurityAnnotationAttributes"/>

<!-- use autoProxy by bean name to apply aspect across all services
-->
<bean id="securityAutoProxyCreator"
class="org.springframework.aop.framework.autoproxy.BeanNameAutoProxyCreator">
<property name="proxyTargetClass" value="true"/>
<property name="interceptorNames">
<list>
<value>methodSecurityInterceptor</value>
</list>
</property>
<property name="beanNames">
<list>
<!-- use wildcard *Service ? -->
<value>helloService</value>
</list>
</property>
</bean>

<!-- **************************************************
concurrent session handling

  • also requires session listener, and session expirty
    to be configured in web.xml
  • be aware that if only one session is allowed, and a
  • user does not log out, they cannot log in until
    their session has expired. There may be an improvement
    to this soon from SPring/Acegi allowing last session
    to be picked up.
    see: http://forum.springframework.org/showthread.php?t=13715&page=2&highlight=Concurrent+Session+Handling
    Also seems to have conflicts with remeberMe.
    Disabled for now
                                                                                                        • -->
                                                                                                          <!--
                                                                                                          <bean id="sessionRegistry"
                                                                                                          class="org.acegisecurity.concurrent.SessionRegistryImpl"/>

<bean id="concurrentSessionController"
class="org.acegisecurity.concurrent.ConcurrentSessionControllerImpl">
<property name="maximumSessions"><value>1</value></property>
<property name="sessionRegistry" ref="sessionRegistry" />
</bean>
-->
</beans>

Sorry for the late response, it's been a crazy week. I posted the original question on the discussion group. Like you said, it's probably a configuration thing.

The configuration code follows (I hope it formats okay):

<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>
<!DOCTYPE beans PUBLIC "-//SPRING//DTD BEAN//EN" "http://www.springframework.org/dtd/spring-beans.dtd
">
<beans>
<bean id="filterChainProxy" class="org.acegisecurity.util.FilterChainProxy">
<property name="filterInvocationDefinitionSource">
<value>
CONVERT_URL_TO_LOWERCASE_BEFORE_COMPARISON
PATTERN_TYPE_APACHE_ANT
/**=httpSessionContextIntegrationFilter,authenticationProcessingFilter,requestWrapper,switchUserProcessingFilter,anonymousProcessingFilter,exceptionTranslationFilter,filterInvocationInterceptor </value>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="switchUserProcessingFilter" class="org.acegisecurity.ui.switchuser.SwitchUserProcessingFilter">
<property name="userDetailsService" ref="employeeDao"/>
<property name="switchUserUrl">
<value>/benefits/enroll/admin/j_acegi_switch_user</value>
</property>
<property name="exitUserUrl">
<value>/benefits/enroll/admin/j_acegi_exit_user</value>
</property>
<property name="targetUrl">
<value>/benefits/enroll/admin/GetCurrentUserStatus.soa</value>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="requestWrapper" class="org.acegisecurity.wrapper.SecurityContextHolderAwareRequestFilter"/>

<bean id="authenticationManager" class="org.acegisecurity.providers.ProviderManager">
<property name="providers">
<list>
<ref bean="unidataAuthenticationProvider"/>
<ref local="anonymousAuthenticationProvider"/>
</list>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="anonymousAuthenticationProvider" class="org.acegisecurity.providers.anonymous.AnonymousAuthenticationProvider">
<property name="key">
<value>foobar</value>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="anonymousProcessingFilter" class="org.acegisecurity.providers.anonymous.AnonymousProcessingFilter">
<property name="key">
<value>foobar</value>
</property>
<property name="userAttribute">
<value>anonymousUser,ROLE_ANONYMOUS</value>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="exceptionTranslationFilter" class="org.acegisecurity.ui.ExceptionTranslationFilter">
<property name="authenticationEntryPoint">
<bean class="org.acegisecurity.ui.webapp.AuthenticationProcessingFilterEntryPoint">
<property name="loginFormUrl" value="/employee_login.html"/>
<property name="forceHttps" value="true"/>
</bean>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="unidataAuthenticationProvider" class="com.rcwilley.business.employee.EmployeeDaoAuthenticationProvider">
<property name="userDetailsService">
<ref bean="employeeDao"/>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="httpSessionContextIntegrationFilter" class="org.acegisecurity.context.HttpSessionContextIntegrationFilter">
<property name="context">
<value>org.acegisecurity.context.SecurityContextImpl</value>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="authenticationProcessingFilter" class="org.acegisecurity.ui.webapp.AuthenticationProcessingFilter">
<property name="authenticationManager">
<ref bean="authenticationManager"/>
</property>
<property name="authenticationFailureUrl">
<value>/employee_error.html</value>
</property>
<property name="defaultTargetUrl">
<value>/welcome.soa</value>
</property>
<property name="filterProcessesUrl">
<value>/j_acegi_security_check</value>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="authenticationProcessingFilterEntryPoint" class="org.acegisecurity.ui.webapp.AuthenticationProcessingFilterEntryPoint">
<property name="loginFormUrl">
<value>/employee_login.html</value>
</property>
<property name="forceHttps">
<value>true</value>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="httpRequestAccessDecisionManager" class="org.acegisecurity.vote.AffirmativeBased">
<property name="allowIfAllAbstainDecisions">
<value>false</value>
</property>
<property name="decisionVoters">
<list>
<ref bean="roleVoter"/>
</list>
</property>
</bean>

<bean id="roleVoter" class="org.acegisecurity.vote.RoleVoter"/>

<bean id="filterInvocationInterceptor" class="org.acegisecurity.intercept.web.FilterSecurityInterceptor">
<property name="authenticationManager">
<ref bean="authenticationManager"/>
</property>
<property name="accessDecisionManager">
<ref local="httpRequestAccessDecisionManager"/>
</property>
<property name="objectDefinitionSource">
<value>
CONVERT_URL_TO_LOWERCASE_BEFORE_COMPARISON
PATTERN_TYPE_APACHE_ANT
/*/.css=ROLE_ANONYMOUS,ROLE_ADMIN,ROLE_EMPLOYEE
/images/**=ROLE_ANONYMOUS,ROLE_ADMIN,ROLE_EMPLOYEE
/employee_login.html*=ROLE_ANONYMOUS,ROLE_ADMIN,ROLE_EMPLOYEE
/employee_error.html*=ROLE_ANONYMOUS,ROLE_ADMIN,ROLE_EMPLOYEE
/benefits/enroll/admin/**=ROLE_ADMIN,ROLE_PREVIOUS_ADMINISTRATOR
/**=ROLE_ADMIN,ROLE_EMPLOYEE
</value>
</property>
</bean>

</beans>

Guys, I've reopened the issue. Would you mind attaching your patches to the task (formatting is easier) and also sexplaining the exact URLs you were presenting which caused the problem. From there I will check the configuration and, if it looks OK, write a unit test which uses FilterSecurityInterceptor with your presented URLs and configuration entries to see if the problem can be reproduced.
Hi Ben. Here's the config file. Doesn't one of the sample applications have switch_user configured? - for testing?

I think the issue is that SwitchUserProcessingFilter appears in FilterChainProxy before the FilterSecurityInterceptor. Appearing before it, there is no chance for the latter to protect the URLs. Would you please move SwitchUserProcessingFilter to AFTER the FilterSecurityInterceptor and advise if this corrects the issue.
Moved to 1.0.4 so Mark can look at it.
sorry. not in a position to test at the moment. away for next few weeks. H

Ben, I tried your suggestion of putting the SwitchUserProcessingFIlter after the FilterSecurityInterceptor in the FilterChainProxy and now it works great and intercepts the url correctly. Thinking back, I think I had incorrectly read section 3.2 of the manual. It indicates that order of the filters declared in the FilterChainProxy is very important. I think I somehow saw that the FilterSecurityInterceptor was last in that list and thought that it should always be last.
I'm just glad that it's working now. Thanks for the help and apologies for the misunderstanding.

Glad the issue is resolved. Documentation does needs updating though as it does show the filters in the incorrect order in Chapter 6.1 (not viewable n PDF as line is too long, but can be viewed i HTML version). I imagine that many people would cut & paste this config.

Anyway. Thank for looking into it

Howie

Hi. Sorry for the delay in getting to test the fix (been overseas). Yes, I can confirm that putting the SwitchUserProcessingFIlter after the FilterSecurityInterceptor fixes the issue. As mentioned before, examples in documentation suggest otherwise.

Thanks for your assistance
Issue resolved by moving SwitchUserProcessingFilter to AFTER the FilterSecurityInterceptor in section 6.1 of the reference guide.
This issue has been migrated to https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-security/issues/637
